translated: 2Here is the corrected and aligned text:ğŸ”½MahÄprajÃ±ÄpÄramitÄ-sÅ«tra, Scroll 306
Translated by Tripiá¹­aka Master Xuanzang on Imperial Order
Chapter 41, Part 2: The Mother of the Buddha, Section on the Primary Aspect
Furthermore, SubhÅ«ti!
All TathÄgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Enlightened Ones, relying on the profound prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ, know form as it really is, know feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness as they really are.
World-Honored One!
How do the TathÄgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Enlightened Ones know form as it really is, know feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness as they really are?
SubhÅ«ti!

All TathÄgatas, Arhats, Samyak-Saá¹ƒbuddhas truly know form as it is, as true suchness, as the dharma realm, as the dharma nature, not false, not changing, not discriminating, without characteristics, without function, without conceptual proliferation, and without attainment. They truly know feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness as they are, as true suchness, as the dharma realm, as the dharma nature, not false, not changing, not discriminating, without characteristics, without function, without conceptual proliferation, and without attainment.
SubhÅ«ti!

In this way, the TathÄgata, Arhat, Samyak-Saá¹ƒbuddha, relying on the profound prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ, truly knows the minds and mental factors of other sentient beings' comings and goings, bendings and stretchings, as they are, as true suchness, as the dharma realm, as the dharma nature, not false, not changing, not discriminating, without characteristics, without function, without conceptual proliferation, and without attainment.
SubhÅ«ti!
The suchness of the mind and mental factors of all sentient beings coming and going, bending and stretching is the suchness of the five aggregates
, the suchness of the five aggregates is the suchness of the twelve sense bases, the suchness of the twelve sense bases is the suchness of the
eighteen elements, the suchness of the eighteen elements is the suchness of the six elements, the suchness of the six elements is the suchness of
the twelve links of dependent arising, the suchness of the twelve links of dependent arising is the suchness of all dharmas,
the suchness of all dharmas is the suchness of the six perfections, the suchness of the six perfections is the suchness of
inner emptiness, outer emptiness, inner and outer emptiness, empty emptiness, great emptiness, ultimate emptiness,
emptiness of conditioned phenomena, emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, absolute emptiness, emptiness without beginning or end,ğŸ”½dispersed emptiness,
unchanging emptiness, emptiness of inherent characteristics, emptiness of common characteristics, emptiness of all
dharmas, emptiness of non-apprehension, emptiness of nature, emptiness of self-nature, emptiness of the nature of non-existence,ğŸ”½and emptiness of the nature of self-nature.
The suchness of emptiness, the suchness of inner emptiness, up to the suchness of the emptiness of the nature of non-existence of non-existing things, is the suchness of true suchness,

the dharma realm, the dharma nature, the non-false nature, the unchanging nature, the equality nature, the nature of separation from birth, the dharma determination, the dharma abode, the ultimate reality, the space element, and the inconceivable element.

The suchness of the space element and the inconceivable element is the suchness of the noble truths of suffering, accumulation, cessation, and path. The suchness of the noble truths of suffering, accumulation, cessation, and path is the suchness of the four mindfulnesses.

The suchness of the four mindfulnesses is the suchness of the four right efforts. The suchness of the four right efforts is the suchness of the four bases of supernatural powers. The suchness of the four bases of supernatural powers is the suchness of the five faculties.
The suchness of the five faculties is the suchness of the five powers. The suchness of the five powers is the suchness of the seven factors of enlightenment.
The suchness of the seven factors of enlightenment is the suchness of the eightfold noble path. The suchness of the eightfold noble path is the suchness of the four fruits of the Å›ramaá¹‡a.
Just as the suchness of the four meditations is the suchness of the four immeasurable [minds],
The suchness of the four immeasurable [minds] is the suchness of the four formless concentrations, and the suchness of the four formless concentrations is the suchness of
The eight liberations, the suchness of the eight liberations is the suchness of the eight superior [meditations], and the suchness of the eight
superior [meditations] is the suchness of the nine sequential concentrations, the suchness of the nine sequential concentrations is the suchness of the ten universal
contemplations, and the suchness of the ten universal contemplations is the suchness of the three gateways to liberation,
The suchness of the three gateways to liberation is the suchness of the ten grounds of the bodhisattvas, and the suchness of the ten grounds of the bodhisattvas is the suchness of the five eyes,
The suchness of the five eyes is the suchness of the six supernormal knowledges, and the suchness of the six supernormal knowledges is the suchness of
All the dhÄraá¹‡Ä« gateways, the suchness of all the dhÄraá¹‡Ä« gateways is the suchness of all
The samÄdhi gateways, the suchness of all the samÄdhi gateways is the suchness of the ten powers of the Buddha,
The suchness of the ten powers of a buddha is the suchness of the four forms of fearlessness, the suchness of the four forms of fearlessness
is the suchness of the four unobstructed understandings, the suchness of the four unobstructed understandings is the suchness of great kindness, great
compassion, great joy, and great abandonment, the suchness of great kindness, great compassion, great joy, and great
abandonment is the suchness of the eighteen distinctive abilities of a buddha, the suchness of the eighteen distinctive abilities of a buddha
is the suchness of the power of non-forgetfulness, the suchness of the power of non-forgetfulness is the suchness of the nature of constant abandonment,
the suchness of the nature of constant abandonment is the suchness of omniscience, the suchness of omniscience
is the suchness of the cognition of the path, the suchness of the cognition of the path is the suchness of the cognition of all aspects,
the suchness of the cognition of all aspects is the suchness of wholesome dharmas, the suchness of wholesome dharmas is the suchness of unwholesome
dharmas, the suchness of unwholesome dharmas is the suchness of indeterminate dharmas, the suchness of indeterminate dharmas
Just as the suchness of worldly dharmas, the suchness of worldly dharmas is the suchness of supramundane dharmas
, the suchness of supramundane dharmas is the suchness of contaminated dharmas, the suchness of contaminated dharmas is

the suchness of uncontaminated dharmas, the suchness of uncontaminated dharmas is the suchness of dharmas with faults, the suchness of dharmas with faults is the suchness of dharmas without faults, the suchness of dharmas without faults is the suchness of defiled dharmas
, the suchness of defiled dharmas is the suchness of pure dharmas, the suchness of pure dharmas is
the suchness of past dharmas, the suchness of past dharmas is the suchness of future dharmas, the suchness of
future dharmas is the suchness of present dharmas, the suchness of present dharmas is the suchness of dharmas of the desire realm
, the suchness of dharmas of the desire realm is the suchness of dharmas of the form realm, the suchness of dharmas of the form realm is
the suchness of dharmas of the formless realm, the suchness of dharmas of the formless realm is the suchness of conditioned dharmas,
The suchness of conditioned dharmas is the suchness of unconditioned dharmas, the suchness of unconditioned dharmas is the suchness of the fruit of stream-entry,

the suchness of the fruit of stream-entry is the suchness of the fruit of once-returning, the suchnessğŸ”½of the fruit of once-returning is the suchness of the fruit of non-returning, the suchness of the fruit of non-returning is the suchness of the fruit of arhatship,

the suchness of the fruit of arhatship is the suchness of pratyekabuddha enlightenment, the suchnessğŸ”½of pratyekabuddha enlightenment is the suchness of the practices of all bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas, the suchness

of the practices of all bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas is the suchness of the unsurpassed perfect enlightenment of all buddhas, the suchnessğŸ”½of the unsurpassed perfect enlightenment of all buddhas is the suchness of all tathÄgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened ones, and the suchness
of all tathÄgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened ones is the suchness of all sentient beings.
SubhÅ«ti!

If the true suchness of all TathÄgatas, Arhats, Samyak-Saá¹ƒbuddhas, the true suchness of all sentient beings, and the true suchness of all dharmas are non-dual and undifferentiated, it is one true suchness.
This true suchness is without distinction, without destruction, without end, and cannot be discriminated.
SubhÅ«ti!

All TathÄgatas, Arhats, Samyak-Saá¹ƒbuddhas, relying on the profound prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ, realize the true suchness of all dharmas and attain supreme perfect enlightenment. For this reason, it is said that the profound prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ can give birth to Buddhas, is the mother of Buddhas, and can show the true reality of the world to Buddhas.
SubhÅ«ti!
In this way, the TathÄgata, Arhat, Samyak-Saá¹ƒbuddha, relying on the profound prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ, truly realizes the true suchness of all dharmas without falsehood or change.
Because of truly realizing the characteristic of true suchness, he is called the TathÄgata, Arhat, Samyak-Saá¹ƒbuddha.
At that time, the Venerable SubhÅ«ti addressed the Buddha, saying:
World-Honored One!
The true nature of all dharmas realized through the profound prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ is non-false and unchanging, which is extremely profound, difficult to see, and difficult to understand.
World-Honored One!
All TathÄgatas, Arhats, and Samyaksaá¹ƒbuddhas use the true nature of all dharmas, which is non-false and unchanging, to reveal and explain the unsurpassed perfect enlightenment of the Buddhas.
World-Honored One!
Who can believe and understand the profound true nature of all dharmas?

Only the Bodhisattva-MahÄsattvas who are irreversible, and the Arhats whose defilements have ended and who are endowed with right view, can give rise to faith and understanding when hearing the Buddha speak of this profound true nature. The TathÄgata reveals and explains it based on the characteristics of the true nature he has realized himself.
The Buddha said:
SubhÅ«ti!ğŸ”½It is so!
It is so!
As you have said.
Why is it so?
SubhÅ«ti!
Suchness is inexhaustible, therefore it is very profound.
World-Honored One!
Why is suchness inexhaustible?
SubhÅ«ti!
Because all dharmas are inexhaustible, suchness is inexhaustible.
SubhÅ«ti!

All TathÄgatas, Arhats, and Samyaksaá¹ƒbuddhas, because they realize suchness, attain unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, and for the sake of sentient beings, reveal and explain the characteristics of suchness of all dharmas. For this reason, they are called true speakers.

At that time, the devas of the desire realm and form realm in the trichiliocosm each scattered various kinds of heavenly wonderful flowers and incense from afar to make offerings, and then came to where the Buddha was, bowed their heads at his feet, withdrew to stand to one side, joined their palms in respect, and together said to the Buddha,
World-Honored One!
What are the characteristics of the prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ that you have spoken of?
At that time, the Buddha told the devas,
Devas, you should know!
The profound prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ has emptiness as its characteristic, the profound prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ

has signlessness as its characteristic, the profound prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ has wishlessness as its characteristic,ğŸ”½the profound prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ has non-action as its characteristic, the profound prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ

has non-arising and non-cessation as its characteristic, the profound prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄğŸ”½has non-defilement and non-purification as its characteristic, the profound prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ has essencelessness as its characteristic,
the profound prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ has selflessness as its characteristic, the profound prajÃ±Ä
pÄramitÄ has the nature of essencelessness as its characteristic, the profound prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄğŸ”½has non-reliance as its characteristic, the profound prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ has neither annihilation nor
permanence as its characteristic, the profound prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ has neither singularity nor multiplicity as its characteristic,
The mark of the profound prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ is that it does not come and does not go, the mark of the profound prajÃ±ÄğŸ”½pÄramitÄ is that of space, the profound prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ has the mark ofğŸ”½

The mark of the profound prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ is that it does not come and does not go. The mark of the profound prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ is that of space. The profound prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ has these and other immeasurable marks.
Celestial sons should know!
These marks are all spoken of by the TathÄgatas, the Arhats, the Perfectly Enlightened Ones in accordance with worldly convention, not in accordance with ultimate truth.
Celestial sons should know!
The marks of the profound prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ cannot be destroyed by the worldly gods, humans, and asuras.
Why is this?
Because the worldly gods, humans, and asuras are also marks.
Celestial sons should know!ğŸ”½Marks cannot destroy marks, and marks cannot understand marks.
Marks cannot destroy the absence of marks, and marks cannot understand the absence of marks.
The signless cannot destroy signs, nor can the signless understand signs.
The signless cannot destroy the signless, nor can the signless understand the signless.
Why is this?

Because signs, signlessness, signs and signlessness, the one who destroys, the one who understands, the one who is destroyed, the one who is understood, and the act of destroying and understanding are all non-existent, and cannot be attained.
Heavenly son, you should know!
Such signs are not created by form, nor are they created by feeling, perception, formation, or consciousness;
They are not created by the eye faculty, nor are they created by the ear, nose, tongue, body, or mind faculties;
They are not created by the form faculty, nor are they created by the sound, smell, taste, touch, or dharma faculties;
They are not created by the eye element, nor are they created by the form element, eye-consciousness element, eye contact, or the feelings produced by eye contact.
It is not created by the ear element, the sound element, the ear consciousness element, or by ear contact and the feelings that arise from ear contact as a condition;
It is not created by the nose element, the smell element, the nose consciousness element, or by nose contact and the feelings that arise from nose contact as a condition;
It is not created by the tongue element, the taste element, the tongue consciousness element, or by tongue contact and the feelings that arise from tongue contact as a condition;
It is not created by the body element, the touch element, the body consciousness element, or by body contact and the feelings that arise from body contact as a condition;
It is not created by the mind element, the dharma element, the mind consciousness element, or by mind contact and the feelings that arise from mind contact as a condition;
It is not created by the earth element, nor by the water, fire, wind, space, or consciousness elements;

It is not created by ignorance, nor by volitional actions, consciousness, name-and-form, the six sense bases, contact, feeling, craving, grasping, becoming, birth, old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, depression, and anguish.
It is not created by the perfection of generosity, nor by the perfections of morality, patience, diligence, concentration, or wisdom.

It is not created by the emptiness of internal phenomena, nor by the emptiness of external phenomena, the emptiness of both external and internal phenomena, the emptiness of emptiness, the great emptiness, the ultimate emptiness, the emptiness of conditioned phenomena, the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, the absolute emptiness, the emptiness of the unlimited, the emptiness of that which has neither beginning nor end, the emptiness of non-disappearance, the emptiness of inherent existence, the emptiness of all phenomena, the emptiness of non-apprehension, the emptiness of intrinsic nature, the emptiness of the intrinsic nature of non-existence, or the emptiness of the intrinsic nature of all phenomena.

It is not created by suchness, the realm of the Dharma, the nature of the Dharma, the unmistaken nature, the unchanging nature, the fundamental nature, the nature devoid of arising, the determination of the Dharma, the establishment of the Dharma, the ultimate reality, the realm of space, or the inconceivable realm;
It is not created by the noble truth of suffering, nor by the noble truths of the accumulation, cessation, or path of suffering;
It is not created by the four meditations, nor by the four immeasurable [minds] or four formless concentrations;
It is not created by the eight liberations, nor by the eight superior [spheres of] perception, the nine successive [meditations], or the ten universal bases;

It is not created by the four establishments of mindfulness, nor by the four right efforts, four bases of supernatural power, five faculties, five powers, seven factors of enlightenment, or eightfold noble path;
It is not created by the door of liberation of emptiness, nor by the door of liberation of signlessness or wishlessness;
It is not created by the ten grounds of the bodhisattva;
It is not created by the five eyes, nor by the six supernatural powers;

It is not created by the ten powers of the Buddha, the four fearlessnesses, the four unobstructed understandings, great kindness, great compassion, great joy, great equanimity, or the eighteen distinctive abilities of the Buddha;
it is not created by the absence of forgetfulness, nor is it created by the constant abiding in equanimity;
it is not created by omniscience, nor is it created by the cognition of the path, nor by the cognition of all aspects;
it is not created by all the dhÄraá¹‡Ä« gateways, nor is it created by all the samÄdhi gateways;
it is not created by the fruit of entering the stream, nor is it created by the fruit of the once-returner, the fruit of the non-returner, or the fruit of arhatship;
it is not created by the enlightenment of a pratyekabuddha;
it is not created by the practices of all bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas, nor is it created by the unsurpassed perfect enlightenment of the buddhas.
Son of Heaven, you should know!

Such characteristics are not created by the gods, not created by the non-gods, not created by humans, not created by the non-humans, not with outflows, not without outflows, not worldly, not supramundane, not conditioned, not unconditioned, not subject to anything, and cannot be explained.
Celestial sons should know!
The profound prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ is far removed from various characteristics, and one should not ask what the characteristics of the profound prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ are.
The Buddha told the celestial sons:
What do you think?
If someone asks, 'What are the characteristics of space?' is such a question proper?
The celestial sons said:
No, World-Honored One!
Why is it so?
Because space has no substance, no characteristics, and is unconditioned, and should not be asked about.
The Buddha told the celestial sons:
The profound prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ is also like this, and should not be asked about.

However, the characteristics of all dharmas, whether there is a Buddha or not, are the nature of the Dharma realm. The Buddha realizes these characteristics as they truly are, and is therefore called the TathÄgata.
At that time, the sons of the gods again said to the Buddha:

The characteristics realized by the TathÄgata are extremely profound, difficult to see and difficult to understand. Because the TathÄgata presently realizes these characteristics, unobstructed wisdom arises regarding all dharmas.

All TathÄgatas, Arhats, and Perfectly Enlightened Ones abide in these characteristics and, by distinguishing and revealing them, expound the profound prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ. For the sake of sentient beings, they gather the characteristics of all dharmas and skillfully reveal them, enabling them to attain unobstructed wisdom regarding prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ.
How rare!
World-Honored One!

The profound prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ is the place where all tathÄgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened ones always practice. Because all tathÄgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened ones practice this place, they attain supreme perfect enlightenment, and for the sake of all sentient beings, they analyze and reveal the characteristics of all dharmas, namely, they analyze and reveal the characteristics of form, they analyze and reveal the characteristics of feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness;
they analyze and reveal the characteristics of the eye sense base, they analyze and reveal the characteristics of the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind sense bases;
they analyze and reveal the characteristics of the form sense base, they analyze and reveal the characteristics of the sound, smell, taste, touch, and dharma sense bases;

they analyze and reveal the characteristics of the eye element, they analyze and reveal the characteristics of the form element, eye consciousness element, and eye contact, as well as the feelings produced from eye contact as a condition;

they analyze and reveal the characteristics of the ear element, they analyze and reveal the characteristics of the sound element, ear consciousness element, and ear contact, as well as the feelings produced from ear contact as a condition;

Distinguishing and revealing the characteristics of the nose sense-field, distinguishing and revealing the characteristics of the smell sense-object, nose consciousness sense-field, nose contact, and the various feelings produced with nose contact as their condition;

Distinguishing and revealing the characteristics of the tongue sense-field, distinguishing and revealing the characteristics of the taste sense-object, tongue consciousness sense-field, tongue contact, and the various feelings produced with tongue contact as their condition;

Distinguishing and revealing the characteristics of the body sense-field, distinguishing and revealing the characteristics of the touch sense-object, body consciousness sense-field, body contact, and the various feelings produced with body contact as their condition;

Distinguishing and revealing the characteristics of the mind sense-field, distinguishing and revealing the characteristics of the dharma sense-object, mind consciousness sense-field, mind contact, and the various feelings produced with mind contact as their condition;
Distinguishing and revealing the characteristics of the earth element, distinguishing and revealing the characteristics of the water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness elements;

Distinguishing and revealing the characteristics of ignorance, distinguishing and revealing the characteristics of formations, consciousness, name-and-form, the six sense bases, contact, feeling, craving, grasping, becoming, birth, old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, grief, and despair;
Distinguishing and revealing the characteristics of the perfection of giving, distinguishing and revealing the characteristics of morality, patience, diligence, meditation, and wisdom;

Distinguishing and revealing the characteristics of inner emptiness, distinguishing and revealing the characteristics of outer emptiness, inner and outer emptiness, emptiness of emptiness, great emptiness, ultimate emptiness, emptiness of conditioned phenomena, emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, absolute emptiness, emptiness without beginning or end, emptiness of dispersion, emptiness of inherent existence, emptiness of specific characteristics, emptiness of common characteristics, emptiness of all phenomena, emptiness of non-apprehension, emptiness of nature, emptiness of intrinsic nature, and emptiness of the intrinsic nature of non-existence;

Distinguishing and revealing the characteristics of suchness, distinguishing and revealing the characteristics of the dharma realm, dharma nature, non-false nature, unchanging nature, equality nature, birthlessness nature, dharma determination, dharma abiding, reality limit, space realm, and inconceivable realm;

Distinguishing and revealing the characteristics of the noble truth of suffering, distinguishing and revealing the characteristics of the noble truths of the accumulation [of suffering], cessation [of suffering], and the path [to the cessation of suffering];
Distinguishing and revealing the characteristics of the four concentrations, distinguishing and revealing the characteristics of the four immeasurables and four formless concentrations;

Distinguishing and revealing the characteristics of the eight liberations, distinguishing and revealing the characteristics of the eight spheres of mastery, nine successive concentrations, and ten universal bases;

Distinguishing and revealing the characteristics of the four establishments of mindfulness, distinguishing and revealing the characteristics of the four right efforts, four bases of supernatural power, five faculties, five powers, seven factors of enlightenment, and eightfold noble path;
Distinguishing and revealing the characteristics of the emptiness liberation gate, distinguishing and revealing the characteristics of the signless and wishless liberation gates;
Distinguishing and revealing the characteristics of the ten grounds of the bodhisattvas;
Distinguishing and revealing the characteristics of the five eyes, distinguishing and revealing the characteristics of the six supernormal knowledges;

Distinguishing and revealing the characteristics of the ten powers of the Buddha, distinguishing and revealing the characteristics of the four fearlessnesses, four unobstructed understandings, great kindness, great compassion, great joy, great equanimity, and eighteen distinctive abilities of the Buddha;
Distinguishing and revealing the characteristics of the factor of non-forgetfulness, distinguishing and revealing the characteristics of the factor of abiding in relinquishment;
Distinguishing and revealing the characteristics of omniscience, distinguishing and revealing the characteristics of the knowledge of the aspects of the path and the knowledge of all aspects;
Distinguishing and revealing the characteristics of all dhÄraá¹‡Ä« gateways, distinguishing and revealing the characteristics of all samÄdhi gateways;
Distinguishing and revealing the characteristics of the fruit of stream-entry, distinguishing and revealing the characteristics of the fruits of once-returning, non-returning, and arhatship;
Distinguishing and revealing the characteristics of pratyekabuddha enlightenment;
Distinguishing and revealing the characteristics of the practices of all bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas;
Distinguishing and revealing the characteristics of the unsurpassed perfect enlightenment of the buddhas.
At that time, the World-Honored One told the celestial beings:ğŸ”½So it is!
So it is!
As you have said.
Celestial beings, you should know!
The Tathagata truly realizes the characteristics of all dharmas as signless. That is to say, obstruction is the characteristic of form, which the Tathagata truly realizes as signless;
Sensation is the characteristic of feeling, which the Tathagata truly realizes as signless;ğŸ”½Perceiving is the characteristic of perception, which the Tathagata truly realizes as signless;
Forming is the characteristic of mental formations, which the Tathagata truly realizes as signless;
Cognition is the characteristic of consciousness, which the Tathagata truly realizes as signless;
The aggregate of suffering is the characteristic of the aggregates, which the Tathagata truly realizes as signless;
The gateway of arising is the characteristic of the sense bases, which the Tathagata truly realizes as signless;
Many poisons and harms are the characteristic of the elements, which the Tathagata truly realizes as signless;
The characteristic of dependent origination arising in combination is that the TathÄgata realizes it as signless.

The characteristic of the perfection of giving is being able to give generously, which the TathÄgata realizes as signless.ğŸ”½The characteristic of the perfection of morality is being free from vexation, which the TathÄgata realizes as signless.
The characteristic of the perfection of patience is being free from anger, which the TathÄgata realizes as signless.

The characteristic of the perfection of vigor is being invincible, which the TathÄgata realizes as signless.ğŸ”½The characteristic of the perfection of concentration is concentrating the mind, which the TathÄgata realizes as signless.
The characteristic of the perfection of wisdom is being unobstructed, which the TathÄgata realizes as signless.
The characteristic of inner emptiness, etc. is being nonexistent, which the TathÄgata realizes as signless.
The characteristic of suchness, etc. is being non-inverted, which the TathÄgata realizes as signless.

The characteristic of the Four Noble Truths is non-deception, which the TathÄgata realizes as signless;ğŸ”½The characteristic of the Four Meditations is non-disturbance, which the TathÄgata realizes as signless;ğŸ”½The characteristic of the Four Immeasurable Minds is non-obstruction, which the TathÄgata realizes as signless;

The characteristic of the Four Formless Concentrations is non-confusion, which the TathÄgata realizes as signless;ğŸ”½The characteristic of the Eight Liberations is non-bondage, which the TathÄgata realizes as signless;

The characteristic of the Eight Dominant [Meditations] is subduing, which the TathÄgata realizes as signless;ğŸ”½The characteristic of the Nine Sequential Attainments of Concentration is non-dissipation, which the TathÄgata realizes as signless;
The characteristic of the Ten Pervasions is boundless, which the TathÄgata realizes as signless;
The characteristic of the Thirty-Seven Factors of Enlightenment is liberation, which the TathÄgata realizes as signless;
The characteristic of the Door of Liberation of Emptiness is extreme separation, which the TathÄgata realizes as signless;
The characteristic of the signless liberation gate is utmost tranquility, which the TathÄgata realizes as signless;
The characteristic of the wishless liberation gate is aversion to various sufferings, which the TathÄgata realizes as signless;
The characteristic of the ten grounds of the bodhisattvas is heading for great enlightenment, which the TathÄgata realizes as signless;
The characteristic of the five eyes is being able to contemplate and illuminate, which the TathÄgata realizes as signless;
The characteristic of the six supernormal powers is being unobstructed, which the TathÄgata realizes as signless;
The characteristic of the ten powers of the Buddha is being well-determined, which the TathÄgata realizes as signless;
The characteristic of the four fearlessnesses is being well-established, which the TathÄgata realizes as signless;

The characteristic of the four unobstructed understandings is being uninterrupted, which the TathÄgata realizes as signless;ğŸ”½The characteristic of great kindness is bestowing benefits and joy, which the TathÄgata realizes as signless;
The characteristic of great compassion is uprooting afflictions and suffering, which the TathÄgata realizes as signless;
The characteristic of great joy in celebrating goodness is that the TathÄgata realizes it as signless;
The characteristic of great equanimity in abandoning distractions is that the TathÄgata realizes it as signless;
The characteristic of the eighteen distinctive abilities of the Buddha that cannot be taken away is that the TathÄgata realizes it as signless;
The characteristic of the ability to remember well without forgetting is that the TathÄgata realizes it as signless;
The characteristic of the nature of constant abiding in equanimity without attachment is that the TathÄgata realizes it as signless;
The characteristic of the realization of equality is that of omniscience, which the TathÄgata realizes as signless;
The characteristic of thorough understanding is that of the cognition of the aspects of the path, which the TathÄgata realizes as signless;

The characteristic of the realization of distinctions is that of the cognition of all aspects, which the TathÄgata realizes as signless;ğŸ”½The characteristic of the dhÄraá¹‡Ä« gateway that completely encompasses is that the TathÄgata realizes it as signless;

World-Honored One!
How do the Tathagatas, Arhats, and Samyak-sambuddhas know to repay kindness?
Subhuti!

All Tathagatas, Arhats, and Samyak-sambuddhas ride this vehicle and travel this path to arrive at unsurpassed perfect enlightenment. Having attained enlightenment, they always make offerings, pay respects, revere, praise, accept, and uphold this vehicle and this path without the slightest negligence. This vehicle and this path should be known as the profound prajnaparamita.
Subhuti!
This is called the Tathagatas, Arhats, and Samyak-sambuddhas knowing to repay kindness.
Furthermore, Subhuti!

All Tathagatas, Arhats, and Samyak-sambuddhas, without exception, rely on the profound prajnaparamita to fully realize all phenomena with characteristics and without characteristics, without real activity, because the doer does not exist.

The venerable SubhÅ«ti addressed the Buddha, saying:
World-Honored One!

How is it that the profound prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ, by not seeing form, is called 'showing the mark of form,' and by not seeing feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness, is called 'showing the mark of feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness'?

How is it that by not seeing the eye sense base, it is called 'showing the mark of the eye sense base,' and by not seeing the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind sense bases, it is called 'showing the mark of the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind sense bases'?

How is it that not seeing the form realm is called showing the characteristics of the form realm, and not seeing the sound, smell, taste, touch, and dharma realms is called showing the characteristics of the sound, smell, taste, touch, and dharma realms?

How is it that not seeing the eye realm is called showing the characteristics of the eye realm, and not seeing the form realm, eye consciousness realm, eye contact, and the feelings produced by eye contact as a condition is called showing the characteristics of the form realm up to the feelings produced by eye contact as a condition?

How is it that not seeing the ear realm is called showing the characteristics of the ear realm, and not seeing the sound realm, ear consciousness realm, ear contact, and the feelings produced by ear contact as a condition is called showing the characteristics of the sound realm up to the feelings produced by ear contact as a condition?

How is it that not seeing the nose realm is called showing the characteristics of the nose realm, and not seeing the smell realm, nose consciousness realm, nose contact, and the feelings produced by nose contact as a condition is called showing the characteristics of the smell realm up to the feelings produced by nose contact as a condition?

Why is it called showing the characteristics of the tongue element because one does not see the tongue element, and showing the characteristics of the taste element, tongue consciousness element, tongue contact, and the feelings produced from the condition of tongue contact because one does not see them?

Why is it called showing the characteristics of the body element because one does not see the body element, and showing the characteristics of the touch element, body consciousness element, body contact, and the feelings produced from the condition of body contact because one does not see them?

Why is it called showing the characteristics of the mind element because one does not see the mind element, and showing the characteristics of the dharma element, mind consciousness element, mind contact, and the feelings produced from the condition of mind contact because one does not see them?

Why is it called showing the characteristics of the earth element because one does not see the earth element, and showing the characteristics of the water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness elements because one does not see them?

How is it that not seeing ignorance is called showing the characteristic of ignorance, and not seeing volitional formations, consciousness, name-and-form, the six sense bases, contact, feeling, craving, grasping, becoming, birth, aging and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, depression, and distress is called showing the characteristic of volitional formations up to aging and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, depression, and distress?

How is it that not seeing the perfection of giving is called showing the characteristic of the perfection of giving, and not seeing the perfection of morality, patience, perseverance, concentration, and wisdom is called showing the characteristic of the perfection of morality up to the perfection of wisdom?

Why is it called demonstrating the characteristics of internal emptiness because one does not see internal emptiness, and not seeing external emptiness, internal and external emptiness, empty emptiness, great emptiness, ultimate emptiness, conditioned emptiness, unconditioned emptiness, absolute emptiness, endless emptiness, dispersed emptiness, unchanging emptiness, inherent emptiness, specific emptiness, common emptiness, all dharmas emptiness, emptiness of non-attainment, nature emptiness, self-nature emptiness, emptiness of the nature of non-existence is called demonstrating the characteristics of external emptiness up to the emptiness of the nature of non-existence?

Why is it called demonstrating the characteristics of suchness because one does not see suchness, and not seeing the dharma realm, dharma nature, non-false nature, unchanging nature, equality nature, separation from birth nature, dharma determination, dharma abiding, reality limit, space realm, inconceivable realm is called demonstrating the characteristics of the dharma realm up to the inconceivable realm?

How is it that not seeing the noble truth of suffering is called demonstrating the characteristics of the noble truth of suffering, and not seeing the noble truths of the accumulation, cessation, and path is called demonstrating the characteristics of the noble truths of the accumulation, cessation, and path?

How is it that not seeing the four meditations is called demonstrating the characteristics of the four meditations, and not seeing the four immeasurables and four formless concentrations is called demonstrating the characteristics of the four immeasurables and four formless concentrations?

How is it that not seeing the eight liberations is called demonstrating the characteristics of the eight liberations, and not seeing the eight bases of mastery, nine successive concentrations, and ten universal bases is called demonstrating the characteristics of the eight bases of mastery, nine successive concentrations, and ten universal bases?

How is it that not seeing the four establishments of mindfulness is called demonstrating the characteristics of the four establishments of mindfulness, and not seeing the four right efforts, four bases of supernatural power, five faculties, five powers, seven factors of enlightenment, and eightfold noble path is called demonstrating the characteristics of the four right efforts up to the eightfold noble path?

Why is it called demonstrating the characteristics of the emptiness liberation gate because one does not see the emptiness liberation gate, and why is it called demonstrating the characteristics of the signless and wishless liberation gates because one does not see the signless and wishless liberation gates?
Why is it called demonstrating the characteristics of the ten bodhisattva grounds because one does not see the ten bodhisattva grounds?

Why is it called demonstrating the characteristics of the five eyes because one does not see the five eyes, and why is it called demonstrating the characteristics of the six supernormal knowledges because one does not see the six supernormal knowledges?

Why is it called demonstrating the characteristics of the ten powers of the Buddha because one does not see the ten powers of the Buddha, and why is it called demonstrating the characteristics of the four fearlessnesses, four unobstructed understandings, great kindness, great compassion, great joy, great equanimity, and eighteen distinctive abilities of the Buddha because one does not see the four fearlessnesses up to the eighteen distinctive abilities of the Buddha?

Why is it called demonstrating the characteristics of the factor of non-forgetfulness because one does not see the factor of non-forgetfulness, and why is it called demonstrating the characteristics of the nature of constant relinquishment because one does not see the nature of constant relinquishment?

Why is it called demonstrating the characteristics of omniscience without seeing omniscience, and demonstrating the characteristics of the knowledge of path aspects and the knowledge of all aspects without seeing the knowledge of path aspects and the knowledge of all aspects?

Why is it called demonstrating the characteristics of all dhÄraá¹‡Ä« gateways without seeing all dhÄraá¹‡Ä« gateways, and demonstrating the characteristics of all samÄdhi gateways without seeing all samÄdhi gateways?

Why is it called demonstrating the characteristics of the fruit of stream-entry without seeing the fruit of stream-entry, and demonstrating the characteristics of the fruits of once-returning, non-returning, and arhatship without seeing the fruits of once-returning, non-returning, and arhatship?
Why is it called demonstrating the characteristics of pratyekabuddha enlightenment without seeing pratyekabuddha enlightenment?
Why is it called demonstrating the characteristics of the practices of all bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas without seeing the practices of all bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas?
Why is it called demonstrating the characteristics of the unsurpassed perfect enlightenment of all buddhas without seeing the unsurpassed perfect enlightenment of all buddhas?
